## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 630, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space, \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space, \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space, \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge, \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant, \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass constant, \(u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron, \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton, \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant, \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant, \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant, \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant, \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall, \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 102, 620, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 168, 89]]<|/det|>
## Formulae  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 109, 326, 127]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 163, 275, 180]]<|/det|>

gravitational potential,

hydrostatic pressure,  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 285, 287]]<|/det|>
pressure of an ideal gas,  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 305, 284, 321]]<|/det|>
simple harmonic motion,  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 339, 310, 356]]<|/det|>
velocity of particle in s.h.m.,  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 394, 222, 410]]<|/det|>
electric potential,  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 429, 245, 445]]<|/det|>
capacitors in series,

capacitors in parallel,

energy of charged capacitor,

resistors in series,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 107, 559, 144]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 524, 180]]<|/det|>
\[W = \rho \Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 193, 536, 223]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 235, 522, 252]]<|/det|>
\[\rho = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 262, 571, 294]]<|/det|>
\[\rho = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V} < c^2 >\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 304, 536, 320]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 339, 608, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_{0}^{2} - \chi^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 384, 537, 418]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 426, 625, 445]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 459, 593, 477]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 491, 527, 515]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 527, 593, 546]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 560, 625, 579]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 593, 561, 611]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 628, 581, 647]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 656, 536, 689]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[298, 72, 700, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 103, 96, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 428, 121]]<|/det|>
A cylindrical disc is shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[281, 133, 665, 304]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 326, 509, 344]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 358, 546, 375]]<|/det|>
The disc has diameter \(28 \text{mm}\) and thickness \(12 \text{mm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 373, 554, 391]]<|/det|>
The material of the disc has density \(6.8 \times 10^{3} \text{kg} \text{m}^{-3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 404, 594, 421]]<|/det|>
Calculate, to two significant figures, the weight of the disc.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[510, 632, 876, 650]]<|/det|>
<form>weight = ............................................... N [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 554, 92]]<|/det|> The time \(T\) for a satellite to orbit the Earth is given by <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[421, 92, 534, 128]]<|/det|> \[T = \sqrt{\left(\frac{KR^3}{M}\right)}\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 672, 153]]<|/det|> where \(R\) is the distance of the satellite from the centre of the Earth, <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 150, 400, 168]]<|/det|> \(M\) is the mass of the Earth, <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 306, 184]]<|/det|> and \(K\) is a constant. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 197, 146, 215]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 197, 435, 215]]<|/det|> Determine the SI base units of \(K.\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 352, 880, 371]]<|/det|>
SI base units of \(K\) ...................................... [2] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 384, 146, 403]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 384, 562, 403]]<|/det|> Data for a particular satellite are given in Fig. 2.1. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 415, 680, 520]]<|/det|>
quantitymeasurementuncertainty
\(T\)\(8.64\times 10^{4}s\)\(\pm\) 0.5%
\(R\)\(4.23\times 10^{7}m\)\(\pm\) 1%
\(M\)\(6.0\times 10^{24}kg\)\(\pm\) 2%
<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[271, 529, 560, 551]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 562, 559, 581]]<|/det|> Calculate \(K\) and its actual uncertainty in SI units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 781, 876, 800]]<|/det|> K = ................................................. \(\pm\) ......................................... SI units [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 833, 92]]<|/det|>
Two horizontal metal plates are connected to a power supply, as shown in Fig. 7.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[134, 101, 816, 306]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 324, 510, 343]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 7.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 355, 472, 374]]<|/det|>
The separation of the plates is \(40\mathrm{mm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 386, 875, 421]]<|/det|>
The switch S is then closed so that a potential difference of \(1.2\mathrm{kV}\) is applied across the plates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 433, 181, 452]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 433, 875, 467]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 7.1, draw six field lines to represent the electric field between the metal plates. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 472, 180, 491]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 472, 665, 491]]<|/det|>
Calculate the electric field strength \(E\) between the plates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 583, 846, 602]]<|/det|>
<form>E = ....................................... Vm [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 613, 146, 631]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 613, 875, 663]]<|/det|>
The switch S is opened and the plates lose their charge. Two very small metal spheres A and B joined by an insulating rod are placed between the metal plates as shown in Fig. 7.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[134, 672, 816, 880]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 897, 510, 916]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 7.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 875, 122]]<|/det|>
Sphere A has charge \(- e\) and sphere B has charge \(+ e\), where \(e\) is the charge of a proton. The length AB is \(15 \text{mm}\). The rod is supported at its centre C so that the rod is horizontal and in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 875, 168]]<|/det|>
The switch S is then closed so that the potential difference of \(1.2 \text{kV}\) is applied across the plates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 180, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 180, 779, 198]]<|/det|>
There is a force acting on A due to the electric field between the plates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 196, 494, 214]]<|/det|>
Show that this force is \(4.8 \times 10^{-15} \text{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 339, 875, 357]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 370, 180, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 370, 806, 388]]<|/det|>
The insulating rod joining A and B is fixed in the position shown in Fig. 7.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 384, 623, 403]]<|/det|>
Calculate the torque of the couple acting on the rod.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 543, 875, 561]]<|/det|>

<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 588, 710, 606]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 621, 871, 638]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 664, 871, 681]]<|/det|>
<form>...............................................................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 707, 875, 725]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 710, 875, 727]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
